text: Milano
Less is only more where more is no good.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

text: The object of education is not to fill a man's mind with facts; it is to teach him how to use his mind in thinking.
author: Henry Ford

text: Falsehood is never in words; it is in things.
author: Italo Calvino

text: It doesn't make a damned bit of difference who wins the war to someone who's dead.
author: Joseph Heller

text: You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.
author: Stephen King

text: Time is a great teacher, but unfortunately it kills all its pupils.
author: Louis Hector Berlioz

text: Writing about music is like dancing about architecture.
author: Martin Mull

text: Look up to the sky. You'll never find rainbows if you’re looking down.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly, and applying the wrong remedies.
author: Sir Ernest Benn

text: I don’t want to belong to any club that will accept me as a member.
author: Groucho Marx

text: The strength of the structure has nothing to do with the strength of the material.
author: Shigeru Ban

text: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work in hand. The Sun's rays do not burn until brought to a focus.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: He who studies without passion will never become anything more than a pedant.
author: Stefan Zweig

text: The only kind of education worth while is self-education.
author: Charles Swain Thomas

text: The wonderful thing about standards is that there are so many of them to choose from.
author: Grace Murray Hopper

text: In private life I'm stutterer, but when there are other people I'm ashamed so I speak well.
author: Nino Frassica

text: If knowledge can create problems, it is not through ignorance that we can solve them.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: To be an artist you have to give up everything, including the desire to be a good artist.
author: Jasper Johns

text: Barking dogs never sleep.
author: Nino Frassica

text: What are books but folly, and what is an education but an arrant hypocrisy, and what is art but a curse when they touch not the heart and impel it not to action?
author: Louis Sullivan

text: You can't lose your nerve for the big failure because you need exactly the same nerve for the big success.
author: Regina E. Dugan

text: We shouldn't be looking for heroes, we should be looking for good ideas.
author: Noam Chomsky

text: If the result confirms the hypothesis, then you've made a measurement. If the result is contrary to the hypothesis, then you've made a discovery.
author: Enrico Fermi

text: That men do not learn very much from the lessons of history is the most important of all the lessons that history has to teach.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: You can lade a man up to th' university, but ye can't make him think.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

text: The good work for all education is interest. Until there is interest there is no response.
author: Charles Swain Thomas
